clinical_study.brief_title: Depth of Sedation Regulated by BIS and Its Impact on Delirium Prevalence
clinical_study.official_title: Depth of Sedation Regulated by BIS in Ventilated Critical Care Patients and Its Impact on Delirium Prevalence

brief_summary.textblock: Sedation guided by bispectral index (BIS) is a standard of care during sedation in surgical procedures, but it did not show any usefulness in monitoring the sedation of the patient in the intensive care unit (ICU). However, the studies had a large proportion of patients with superficial sedation and a low proportion of patients with deep sedation (clinical scales lose efficiency). At the same time, the benefit of saving sedatives in the prevention of delirium, reduction of days of ICU and mechanical ventilation is known, for which we propose to evaluate the usefulness of BIS exclusively in patients with deep sedation. The objective of this study is to evaluate the total dose of sedatives and incidence of delirium in patients with deep sedation guided by BIS vs clinical monitoring. It is proposed to perform a prospective, controlled, blind, intervention trial, with random distribution and intention to treat. Patients will be randomized: clinical monitoring group (sedation according to clinical scales) or sedation guided by BIS group. It will be evaluated: the incidence of delirium according to the Confusion Assessment Method for the ICU (CAM-ICU) scale, the dose of sedatives in and the days of admission to the ICU and mechanical ventilation.

detailed_description.textblock:
This will be a prospective intervention trial by intention to treat, controlled, blinded, with random distribution. Patients will be assigned according to the randomization to the clinical monitoring group or Bispectral index (BIS) group. Sedation will be applied as follows:
- Clinical monitoring group: The BIS monitor will be placed on the patient, but blind to the nursing team, with the objective to measure the BIS values and the time remaining under suppression. The Richmond Agitation Sedation Scale (RASS) of the patient will be evaluated twice per nursing shift (every 4 hours). According to the patient's RASS at the time of evaluation, the dose of sedative administered in a continuous infusion pump will be increased or reduced in order to reach the target RASS.
- BIS Group: The BIS value of the patient will be evaluated twice per nursing shift (every 4 hours). The objective of BIS will be between 40 and 60. According to the BIS of the patient at the time of the evaluation, the dose of sedative administered in a continuous infusion pump will be increased or reduced in order to reach the target BIS.
After weaning from deep sedation, the BIS sensor will be removed from the patient. The evaluation of delirium will begin when the patient is in RASS of> -3. This will be measured with the Confusion Assessment Method for the ICU (CAM-UCI) scale in both groups. The measurement will be made by personnel of the research team that did not participate in the randomization. It will also measure the time they remained under suppression, days of ventilation, days of hospitalization and the total dose of sedatives received. The safety outcomes will be the number of unwanted awakenings (recognized as RASS events> -3 during the indication of deep sedation).
The data entry in charge of loading the data of the electronic clinical history will not know the group to which the patient is randomized.
b. Statistical analyses Will be done with the program "STATA 14". The results that present a normal distribution will be evaluated as mean ± SD and analyzed statistically by means of an ANOVA followed by the post-hoc test of Dunnett and Tukey. The differences between proportions will be evaluated through χ2 tests. p <0.05 will be considered significant.
c. Sample size: A study with a power of 80% is projected, a confidence level of 95%, the case: control ratio will be 1: 1 due to randomization. Is expect a delirium incidence of 55% vs 37% in the sedation group guided by BIS (an absolute reduction of 32% in the incidence of delirium). The incidence of delirium in the control group arises from the DECCA trial. In turn, the reduction in the incidence of delirium arises from reviewing the studies included in the meta-analysis by MacKenzie et al. 2018, which reports a reduction of between 20 and 55% in the incidence of delirium due to the use of BIS-guided sedation during surgical procedures. The patients included in this study will have between 24 and 96 hours of deep sedation due to the pathologies that require patients to be deeply sedated (RASS of -4 or -5), which is why is expected to find a reduction in the incidence of delirium and in the dose of sedatives administered equal to or greater than that reported in the studies evaluated by MacKenzie et al.
With this data, a sample size of 240 patients is calculated according to the Fleiss formula for sample size calculation. It is suspected that 10% of the patients will be lost, for which a total number of 264 patients is needed. A single-center study is planned, which will be carried out in the critical care unit of the Hospital Italiano de Buenos Aires. It has 38 beds and an average monthly flow of 140 patients. Of these, 10% have the objective of RASS -4 or -5 (according to the measurement made in April 2018). It is calculated taking into account these data that a duration of 19 months will be required to achieve a necessary sample size.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients will be selected according to the selection criteria. Patients will be assigned according to the randomization to clinical monitoring groups or BIS group. We assume that the use of neuromuscular blockers (NMB) can influence the results, for this reason, we propose stratified randomization by the use of NMB, with the aim of having a symmetric distribution of patients with NMB in both groups. In patients who decide to start NMB after randomization, stratified randomization may not be applied. The person in charge of the randomization will be the principal investigator. The rest of the team will not know the group to which the patient was assigned.
study_design_info.masking_description: The evaluation of the CAM-ICU will be carried out by personnel of the research team that has not participated in the randomization and that doesn't work in the ICU (the main researcher will participate in the randomization). The evaluator will be blinded to the group allocation of the patient. The second blind will be applied to the person in charge of loading the data, who will be responsible for loading the variables found in the patient's electronic medical record. The groups will be divided into group A and group B and the principal investigator will inform the person in charge of uploading the data if the analyzed patient is in one or another group but without informing him if it corresponds to a sedation group guided by BIS or guided by clinical monitoring.

primary_outcome.measure: Compare the incidence of delirium in a patient with deep sedation guided by BIS vs clinical scales.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the date that the patient is in RASS of> -3 until the date that the patient has four negative CAM-ICU tests in a row or when is discharged from the ICU or when the patient dies, whichever came first, assessed up to 14 days.
primary_outcome.description: Discrete numerical variable. When the clinician decides to stop deep sedation, the BIS will be removed. When feasible, i.e. RASS > -3, the patient will be evaluated for delirium by CAM-ICU scale by a research team member properly trained, and blinded to the prior BIS / no BIS distribution (blinding) The delirium evaluation will be done 3 times a day. Variable measured in the field.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the dose of sedatives required in patients with deep sedation guided by BIS vs clinical scales.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date that the patient has in RASS of> -3 or when the patient dies, whichever came first, assessed up to 14 days.
primary_outcome.description: Numeric continuous variable. The dose of sedative drugs administered to the patient during the indication of deep sedation. The values will be charged in mg/kg for midazolam and propofol.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the dose of sedatives required in patients with deep sedation guided by BIS vs clinical scales.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date that the patient has in RASS of> -3 or when the patient dies, whichever came first, assessed up to 14 days.
primary_outcome.description: Numeric continuous variable. The dose of sedative drugs administered to the patient during the indication of deep sedation. The values will be charged in ug/kg for dexmedetomidine and remifentanil.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate safety: number of unwanted awakenings in patients with deep sedation guided by BIS. vs clinical scales.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date that the patient has in RASS of> -3 or when the patient dies, whichever came first, assessed up to 14 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Discrete Numeric variable. Number of unwanted awakening during indication of deep sedation. An unwanted awakening is recognized as an event of RASS> -2 during the indication of deep sedation. Variable obtained in the field.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the time that patient pass with values of BIS less than 40 in patients with deep sedation guided by BIS. vs clinical scales.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date that the patient has in RASS of> -3 or when the patient dies, whichever came first, assessed up to 14 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous numeric variable. Number of hours that the patient had registers of BIS under than 40.

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of stay in ICU in patients with deep sedation guided by BIS. vs clinical scales.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date that the patient is discharged from the ICU or when the patient dies, whichever came first, assessed up to 3 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Numerical discrete variable. Days of hospitalization in the ICU.

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of stay in the hospital in patients with deep sedation guided by BIS. vs clinical scales.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date that the patient is discharged from the hospital or when the patient dies, whichever came first, assessed up to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Numerical discrete variable. Days of hospitalization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Days of mechanical ventilation in patients with deep sedation guided by BIS. vs clinical scales.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date that the patient is extubated or desvinculated of mechanical ventilation, if have a tracheostomy, or when the patient dies, whichever came first, assessed up to 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Numeric continuous variable. The total days in which the patient was ventilated will be reviewed in the medical evolutions.

arm_group.description: In the clinical monitoring group, the doses of sedative drugs will be regulated according to the patient's RASS. The RASS of the patient will be evaluated twice per nursing shift (every 4 hours). The BIS monitor will be placed on the patient, but blind to the nursing team, with the objective to measure the BIS values.

In the group Sedation guided by BIS, the sedation will be guided by the value of BIS. The BIS value of the patient will be evaluated twice per nursing shift (every 4 hours) and will be recorded in the electronic medical record. The objective of BIS will be between 40 and 60. According to the BIS value of the patient at the time of the evaluation, the dose of sedative administered in a continuous infusion pump will be increased or reduced in order to reach the target BIS, with 20% modifications of the current dose at the time of evaluation.

intervention.intervention_name: Monitorization of sedation by Bispectral Index
intervention.description: The BIS value of the patient will be evaluated twice per nursing shift (every 4 hours) and will be recorded in the electronic medical record. The objective of BIS will be between 40 and 60. According to the BIS of the patient at the time of the evaluation, the dose of sedative administered in a continuous infusion pump will be increased or reduced in order to reach the target BIS, with 20% modifications of the current dose at the time of evaluation. The dose of sedative used will be recorded in the electronic medical record. The BIS values will be saved in the equipment and downloaded every 72 hours.

intervention.intervention_name: Monitorization of sedation by clinical scales
intervention.description: The BIS monitor will be placed on the patient but it will be left blind to the nursing team, the BIS values will be stored in the equipment and downloaded every 72 hours. The RASS of the patient will be evaluated twice per nursing shift (every 4 hours) and will be recorded in the electronic medical record. The RASS will be evaluated by a research team member. According to the patient's RASS at the time of evaluation, the dose of sedative administered in a continuous infusion pump will be increased or reduced in order to reach the target RASS. The modification of infusion speed will be done by the nurse in charge of the patient. The dose of sedative applied will be recorded in the electronic medical record.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients older than 18 years.
- Admitted to the intensive care unit of the Hospital Italiano de Buenos Aires and in mechanical ventilation.
- Deep sedation (RASS objective -4, -5) was indicated within the first 48 hours of admission.
- Admission to the ICU or indication of deep sedation up to 8 hours prior to randomization.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with end-of-life care.
- Family refusal to participate in the study.
- Impossibility to place the BIS sensor (burns, extensive lesions on the forehead, prone position, etc.).
- Patients with intracranial hypertension or convulsive status, in whom sedation has the objective of suppressing electroencephalographic waves.
- Patients who, following a decrease in sedation, have a coma, vegetative state or a state of minimal consciousness.
